abilities.description: Creates ghost-like Hollows that pass through targets' bodies, filling them with overwhelming negative thoughts and depression. Victims typically fall to their knees and express extreme self-deprecation or suicidal thoughts.
abilities.limitations: Cannot affect people who are already extremely negative about themselves, as demonstrated by Usopp's natural immunity. The power attacks the mind/spirit rather than the body.
abilities.strength: Can instantly incapacitate even the strongest opponents regardless of their physical strength or combat abilities, as it's a purely mental/psychological attack.

abilities.description: Creates miniature ghosts the size of Perona's palm that can be detonated with a snap of her fingers. The explosions are powerful enough to create holes in stone walls.
abilities.limitations: Requires the user to manually detonate them, giving opponents a brief window to react.
abilities.strength: Provides offensive capability beyond just the psychological Negative Hollows.

abilities.description: A larger version of the Mini Hollow that can physically interact with targets (lifting them, etc.) and causes a massive explosion when detonated.
abilities.limitations: Larger size makes them easier to spot and potentially avoid.
abilities.strength: Combines physical manipulation with explosive power.

abilities.description: Perona connects her consciousness to numerous Negative Hollows throughout Thriller Bark to gather information and monitor what's happening across the entire island.
abilities.strength: Provides comprehensive surveillance and intelligence gathering capabilities.

weaknesses.description: The Negative Hollow ability cannot affect individuals who are already extremely pessimistic and negative about themselves. When used on such a person (like Usopp), the ghosts themselves can become affected by the target's negativity instead.
User cannot swim and is weakened by seawater and Seastone.

keyMoments.title: Negative Hollows Defeat Three Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: Perona's Negative Hollows pass through Zoro, Sanji, and Franky, instantly incapacitating all three with crushing depression despite their strength and willpower.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the overwhelming power of the Horo Horo no Mi against conventional fighters.

keyMoments.title: Discovery of Natural Counter
keyMoments.description: Usopp reveals himself to be completely immune to the Negative Hollows due to his naturally pessimistic personality, shocking Perona and establishing the fruit's fundamental weakness.
keyMoments.significance: First time the Horo Horo no Mi's weakness is revealed, showing that mental state can counter Devil Fruit powers.

keyMoments.title: Negative Hollows Backfire
keyMoments.description: When Perona sends four Negative Hollows through Usopp simultaneously, his extreme negativity causes the ghosts themselves to become depressed, with the effect even reaching Perona.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that the Horo Horo no Mi's weakness isn't just immunity, but can actually backfire on the user when faced with extreme negativity.

culturalReferences.reference: The ghost design is influenced by traditional Japanese yurei (ghosts) and Western cartoon ghosts, creating a unique cute yet eerie aesthetic.

trivia: The Horo Horo no Mi is one of the few Devil Fruits whose power can be completely negated by a personality trait rather than another Devil Fruit or special ability.
The fruit's weakness being natural pessimism creates a thematic parallel to Luffy's rubber body naturally countering Enel's lightning Devil Fruit.
